data.why:
i like to contribute a package for calling LAPACK functions from
    perl PDL.LAPACK offers a lot of really fast linear algebra
    functions. For example, the LAPACK matrix invert function seems to
    be slightly faster than the current 'matinv' from PDL::Slatec. But
    you get a huge speed improvement, if you can call the special LAPACK
    function for inverting a posivive definte matrix. Additionally i
    plan to release another PDL addon especially for time series
    analysis, because i am missing variance, covariance, etc.
